sentences.english: He is a teacher of great scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位学识渊博的教师。

sentences.english: who have a lot more experience and knowledge than I do.
sentences.chinese: 这些人比我有更丰富的经历和更渊博的学识。

sentences.english: His breadth of knowledge filled me with admiration.
sentences.chinese: 他学识渊博，令我非常钦佩。

sentences.english: Zuo Qiuming knowledgeable, virtuous, Confucius made with the same shame.
sentences.chinese: 左丘明知识渊博，品德高尚，孔子言与其同耻。

sentences.english: You were surprised at the extent of his knowledge and the sensitiveness of his taste.
sentences.chinese: 他知识渊博，鉴赏精细，会让你感到惊讶。

sentences.english: He has a competent knowledge of English.
sentences.chinese: 有渊博的古典文学知识。

sentences.english: Her father is a teacher with great learning.
sentences.chinese: 她爸爸是个学术渊博的老师。
他们的谈话显示出渊博学识。

sentences.english: Liu Jun is a famous parallel prose writer of Liang dynasty, is a knowledge profound scholar.
sentences.chinese: 刘峻是梁代著名的骈文家，更是一位知识渊博的学者。

sentences.english: We felt at home with her and were impressed with the depth of her knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 我们与她在一起很放松，她渊博的知识令我们叹服。

sentences.english: Yihe was amiable to everyone, very expansive, erudite, possessing remarkable view.
sentences.chinese: 一禾待人平易，非常健谈，学识渊博，见解独到。

sentences.english: I didn't know you were so encyclopaedic .
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道你竟是这样渊博。

sentences.english: The tension tends to extend to an extra extensive extent.
sentences.chinese: 仓猝倾向于向更渊博的水平扩展。

sentences.english: A professor has a fund of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 有渊博的古典文学知识。

sentences.english: His thorough knowledge and compete nce were recognized.
sentences.chinese: 他的渊博的学识和工作能力得到了承认。

sentences.english: He had broad knowledge and showed great sympathy with the hardship of the people.
sentences.chinese: 他怜人民之疾苦，具有渊博的学识。

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
have wide learning and a retentive memory/have encyclopedic knowledge
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
